channel.title: Got Africa-Inspired!
channel.description: Discover awesome African stories and creations. You too, get inspired!

item.title: Here comes the missing About page
item.description:
I almost forgot adding the About page. Now its done! So what is all this about?

The main purpose of this site is to document and share the awesomeness out there in Africa and within its diaspora, in the mindset, productions, and creations of the people.

It is somewhere between a niche site targeting our success stories and a community blog allowing any contributor to share inspiring articles. We mostly feature video and audio content, but editorial posts are planned for the near future.

If you want to contribute, get in touch via @kamon to suggest a story or help improve the site via our issue tracker on github.com.

item.title: Chale Wote Street Art Festival 2013
item.description:
Chale Wote is a street art festival organised in Accra, Ghana, by Accra [dot] Alt, with support from other cultural networks.

This is the video of the 2013 edition.

You will also enjoy the video montage of the 2012 edition.

item.title: Oritse Femi - Better Remix ft. Vector
The TED talk video you owe yourself to watch
item.description:
The danger of a single story, a TED talk by Chimamanda Adichie.

Brilliant! More than that... Useful! For everyone's challenges in understanding others and himself, and truly connecting to the world.

item.title: Bracket - Mama Africa ft. Flavour
item.description:
The Naija music popular duo does it again with the song Mama Africa.

A video directed by the phenomenal Mattmax.

Go party! Celebrate happiness!

item.title: Africa Straight Up
item.description:
Africa Straight Up documentary film: Beyond the single story, the stereotypes, and the Africa that needs the help of others.

To all my friends, african or not: Watch this film!

item.title: Jesse Jagz - High-Life ft. Rexx
George Ayittey: Africa's cheetahs versus hippos
item.description:
About 6 years ago, I came across the video of this talk by Ghanaian economist Georges Ayittey at TEDGlobal 2007 (Africa: The Next Chapter).

I have listened to it countless of times, along with the one by Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, the finance minister of Nigeria.

These talks were influential for me, helping improve my awareness on a number of issues and understand the changes in action in Africa. Today, I enjoyed listening to them again.

item.title: Paco Sery - Chabada danse
item.description:
A video clip of Paco Sery performing and living on Chabada danse.

A gift by the musician from Côte d'Ivoire, most known as the drummer of the french jazz fusion band Sixun and for his collaboration with Joe Zawinul.

I also love watching this Youtube video of Sixun's 20th anniversary concert, at La Cigale in Paris. If in a hurry, you might want to jump to 39:05 to see the energic part.

Music is love. Enjoy and share!

item.title: BOJ - Wifey ft. Dammy Krane
Juliana Rotich: The Ushahidi project and the BRCK
item.description: Juliana Rotich, cofounder of Ushahidi, talks at TED about the BRCK network solution they developed in Kenya, improving connectivity for developing countries.

item.title: Sona Jobarteh at Africa Festival
item.description:
A video of Sona Jobarteh performing at the 2012 Africa Festival in Würzburg, Germany.

Who is Sona Jobarteh ? Quote from the artist's website:

The first female Kora virtuoso to come from a prestigious West African Griot family.

item.title: Sénamé Agbodjinou: Archicamps, fablabs, and the african smart city idea
item.description: A talk (in french) at Lift in Marseille by Sénamé Agbodjinou of L'Africaine d'Architecture and WoeLab. He presents what they have been doing in Togo with the Archicamps idea, Fablabs, and the dream of an african smart city.

item.title: Ice Prince Zamani interviewed on Soundcity TV's One-on-One show
item.description: This video gives us an opportunity to know more about Ice Prince, one of Africa's leading hip hop artists.

item.title: Women celebrate overcoming poverty through an art project in Ghana
item.description:
G-lish Foundation announces the "Finfinhi: Little by Little" exhibition, including over 50 stunning, unique, recycled, textile art works, on display this month in Sydney.

From G-lish Foundation's blog:

The Australian High Commission in Ghana's Direct Aid Program funded the Community Artisan Project carried out by G-lish Foundation in Ghana. An exhibition of this stunning work is on display now in Sydney at Pine Street Creative Arts Centre in Pine Street, Chippendale.

Check the blog for more on the project, their history, and their work.

item.title: Jason Njoku: Failing all the way to Success
item.description:
Jason Njoku is a Nigerian Internet entrepreneur, and is CEO and founder of Iroko Partners, the creators of IrokoTV.com. In this talk at TEDxEuston 2011, he gives his view on Success, based on his own story and the failures that are part of the entrepreneur's journey.

He keeps repeating something that resonates in me: The importance of embracing failure.
Fear not! Just get going! And let's keep learning from the likes of Jason Njoku, inspirations for the new generation of african entrepreneurs.

item.title: Ice Prince - Kpako ft. M.I & Jesse Jagz
item.description: From the Nigerian artist's second album Fire of Zamani.

item.title: Tech democracy, fablabs and the first 3D printer created in Africa
item.description:
A presentation of W.Afate, the first 3D printer created in Africa by a team lead by Afate Gnikou, in the fablab WoeLab in Togo.

You may also want to check this other video from a show on the french TV Arte.

item.title: Kofi Kinaata - Different ft. Kesse
Ashesi's message to Africa's future
item.description: A very well done promotional video by Ashesi, an african university based in Ghana, created with the ambition to train new leaders on the continent.

item.title: Darey - Sisi Eko Remix ft. Flavour
item.description:
A music video featuring the two Nigerian music stars Darey and Flavour for the remix version of the song Sisi Eko.

Enjoy the joyful atmosphere, colors, the music and dancing from urban Africa!
